title.narrative: Girls' Education Challenge - Programme evaluation costs

description.narrative: This activity (Girls' Education Challenge - Programme evaluation costs) is a component of Girls' Education Challenge (GEC) - help 1 million disadvantaged girls go to primary and secondary school reported by FCDO, with a funding type of 'Procurement of Services' and a budget of £10,322,576. This component benefits Developing countries, unspecified, and works in the following sector(s): Primary education, Basic life skills for youth and adults, Secondary education. , with the following implementing partners: Coffey International Development. The start date is 19-09-2011 and the end date is 31-01-2018.

owner-org.narrative: UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO)

mailing-address.narrative: Public Enquiry Point, Abercrombie House, Eaglesham Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 8EA

sector.narrative: Basic life skills for youth and adults

description.narrative: Education - Social Affairs - Education - advanced technical and managerial training
